A: No. The concept of System Landscape Directory (SLD) does not exist in SAP Integration Suite. Only sender (SAP_Sender) and receiver (SAP_Receiver) identifiers can be reused, typically through Apache Camel headers directly defined in the Integration Flows. See more information in Headers and Exchange Properties Provided by the Integration Framework. When setting up XI proxy scenarios, your business system needs to be maintained in a table. See Setting Up XI Proxy Runtime.

 

Q7. How can I set up centralized monitoring across multiple SAP Integration Suite tenants (e.g., landscape with multiple regions)?
A: You can achieve centralized monitoring of multiple SAP Integration Suite tenants using SAP Cloud ALM (CALM) with its Integration & Exception Monitoring and Health Monitoring capabilities. Here‚Äôs how it works:

  • Integration & Exception Monitoring: CALM lets you correlate individual messages across different tenants and systems into end-to-end business scenarios. You can define "integration scenarios" that span several Integration Suite tenants. Alerts trigger on failed messages, grouped failures, or deployment exceptions, and you can filter by iFlow, sender/receiver, package, etc.
  • Health Monitoring: Collects and displays technical health metrics (e.g., JMS resource usage, certificate validity) across all your Integration Suite tenants in a single pane. https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/health-monitoring/health-monitoring-setup-configuration/health-mon-for-integrationsuite-cloud-intergration.html
  • Alerts & Automation: You can configure alert rules in CALM (for example, for error messages) and trigger operation flows to remediate or notify responsible teams.
  • Role-Based Access: Permissions in CALM let you control who sees what (which tenants, which scenarios) by selecting the right scope in the ‚ÄúSelect Scope‚Äù mode.

This architecture enables a single point of operational visibility across a global, multi-tenant Integration Suite landscape ‚Äî helping operations teams to monitor, alert, and drill down into issues from one central tool. See more information in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) and Integration & Exception Monitoring.

As an alternative, you can also connect SAP Integration Suite with SAP Focused Run for such centralized monitoring. See more information in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) and Health Monitoring for SAP Integration Suite (Edge Integration Cell).

 

Q8. Can I integrate SAP Integration Suite logs with external monitoring tools (Splunk, Dynatrace, Azure Monitor, etc.)?
A: Yes. Cloud Integration supports external logging, allowing you to forward message processing logs to third-party tools. You can activate external logging in the Cloud Foundry environment and configure an HTTP endpoint (for example, a Splunk HEC) as the target. After creating the destination and service key, external logging is enabled through the Cloud Integration API, and log levels can be controlled globally or per Integration Flow. For long-term retention, message logs can also be archived to an external CMIS repository. While Splunk is the primary documented example, similar setups can be used for other monitoring platforms that accept HTTP-based log ingestion. See more information in External Logging Cloud Foundry Environment and Archiving Data, Cloud Foundry Environment.

Please note that SAP strongly discourages from using Message Processing Log Attachments for general message persistence as well when transitioning from the ArchiverModuleBean adapter module in SAP Process Orchestration to Cloud Integration. Log attachments don‚Äôt qualify as a comprehensive archiving solution as the data is only stored in Cloud Integration's internal database for 30 days, after which it's deleted permanently. Incorporating log attachments in this context can also cause a performance issue by burdening the allocated database storage within your Cloud Integration tenant with an excessive influx of MPL entries.

 

Project Enablement and Support

This section is focused on questions related to customer references, enablement and support.

 

Q1: I‚Äôd like to move to SAP Integration Suite, but I‚Äôm new to the solution. Where can I find information to get started?

A: SAP recommends starting with the following references:

  • Developing with SAP Integration Suite
  • Modernize Integration with SAP Integration Suite
  • SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite Migration
  • Get Started with Migration to SAP Integration Suite

 

Q2. Is there a template project plan or checklist available?
A: Please refer to the discovery center mission Get Started with Migration to SAP Integration Suite to get insights on how to start your transformation journey.

 

Q3. Where can I find more success stories of customers that concluded a migration project?
A: Customers can find more success stories in Accelerate your move from SAP Process Orchestration to the cloud.

 

Q4. Who can support me during migration (SAP Services, Partners, Move Experts)?
A: SAP provides dedicated experts to assist customers migrating from SAP Process Orchestration. You can reach out to the SAP Integration Suite Move Experts at: SAPIntegrationSuiteMoveExperts@sap.com

SAP also provides dedicated experts to assist customers on migrating B2B scenarios from SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite. You can reach out to the SAP B2B Integration Factory experts at: b2bintegrationfactory@sap.com.

 

Additional References

Everything you need to move to SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Fast-Track Your Integrations To The Cloud Through Our New Expert-Guided Implementation Service
entry.content:
Fast-Track Your Integration Transformation To The Cloud Through Our New Expert-Guided Implementation service

Are you ready to migrate your critical integration scenarios to the cloud - in a secure and scalable way?

SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council is piloting a new expert guided implementation service (EGI) focused on helping customers starting to migrate their interfaces from SAP Process Integration / Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite. As a participant, you‚Äôll gain exclusive early access to content, influence the final offering with your feedback, and build hands-on experience before general availability. This isn‚Äôt just another webinar - it‚Äôs a practical, step-by-step experience where you‚Äôll migrate interfaces in your own environment, with guidance from an expert throughout.

This structured approach ensures you gain both theoretical knowledge and practical experience, helping you build confidence in using SAP solutions effectively. Since SAP Enterprise Support is included with every SAP cloud subscription, you can access this offering at no additional cost. 

After the completion of the 3-day remote workshop, you will have the knowledge of how to proceed to migrate their interfaces from SAP Process Integration / Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite.

‚ÄãThe purpose of this EGI service is to support customers to begin their migration from SAP Process Integration (PI) / Process Orchestration (PO) to SAP Integration Suite.

‚ÄãFirstly, we discuss the value proposition of migrating to SAP Integration Suite, how to estimate the efforts involved in migrating using the Migration Assessment tool before migrating a simple interface to the SAP Integration Suite using the Migration Tool.

‚ÄãFinally, we prepare customers for developing integration scenarios using SAP Integration Suite in line with best practices using SAP Cloud Connector and the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Please see this teaser video for further information.

What You‚Äôll Gain
 This service will equip you with the skills to leverage:

  • Migration Assessment tool to estimate the efforts involved in migrating interfaces to the cloud
  • Migration Tool to migrate a simple interface to the SAP Integration Suite
  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub to import and use standard integration scenarios

Why It Matters?
Customers should begin their migration from SAP Process Integration (PI) / Process Orchestration (PO) to SAP Integration Suite in advance of end-of-maintenance in 2027.

What You‚Äôll Do?

  • Perform Migration Assessment to understand the effort involved in migrating to SAP Integration Suite.
  • Migrate a standard SAP PO Integrated Configuration Object (ICO) to an Integration Flow (Ready to Migrate).
  • Browse, select, and importing a standard integration package (e.g., Government interaction or Bank integration).
  • Gain practical experience with SAP expert support

Who Should Join?
The service is tailor-made for:

  • Integration consultants
  • Developers

Join the EGI service and gain first-hand experience with SAP‚Äôs latest innovation in multi-model programming. Learn more and register for the service by contacting SAP Enterprise Support Advisory Council through esac@sap.com.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

About the authors: 

  • Robert Kelly is Architect Lead for BTP for SAP Enterprise Support. Based in Dublin, Ireland, Robert has been with SAP since 2005, holding various roles across the organization. Today, he focuses on helping businesses implement their digital transformation through SAP Enterprise Support offerings.  
  • Antonio S√°nchez is the Integration Lead for LAC region at SAP. Based in Mexico City, Mexico, Antonio has over 8 years of experience driving complex integration landscapes (on premise and hybrid). Today, he focuses on helping businesses modernize their landscapes through SAP Integration Suite and Clean Core strategies.
